page.title: 13Colston Bassett, Part Two.
page.content: The local cricket team is called the Forest Amateurs. The Village Institute is a wooden hall used by the school and public. Colston Bassett is a farming area and there are 6 farms in the village. Newlands, Home, Manor and Fern Hill are dairy farms (Friesian castle). Edmondthorpe Lodge is intensive pig breeding, with some beef. Church Farm is all beef. All have some arable land, either barley or wheat or occasionally oil-seed rape. Grass is intensively cultivated, 3 farms making silage mostly, 3 make hay. 4 farms are owned by the Le Marchant Estate, Newlands is privately owned and Fern Hill farm belongs to the Crown. The Dairy is a farmers co-operative, making Stilton cheese the old-fashioned way. { { CONTINUED ON PAGE FIFTEEN.
